pli-tv-bu-vb-sk70:2.1: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk70:6.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk70:6.2: At that time the monks from the group of six were standing while giving teachings to people who were sitting. …
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk70:7.1: “‘I will not give teachings while standing to anyone sitting who is not sick,’ this is how you should train.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk70:8.1: One should not give teachings while standing to anyone sitting who is not sick.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk70:8.2: If a monk out of disrespect give teachings while standing to someone sitting who is not sick, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk70:9.2): if it is unintentional; if he is not mindful; if he does not know; if he is sick; if there are dangers; if he is insane;
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk70:9.2: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk70:10.1: The tenth training rule is finished.
